name: Hippozaenium
Relationship: Compare: MUCO-TOXIN (Cahis' preparation with the micrococcus catarrhalis. Friedlander's Bacillus of Pneumonia and the micrococcus tetragenous - for acute and chronic mucous catarrhs in children and old people.); AUR.; KALI-BICH.; PSOR.; BACILLI.

Respiratory: Bronchitis in the aged, where suffocation from excessive secretion is imminent
Nose: Papules and ulceration in frontal sinus and pharynx
Face: All glands swollen; painful; form abscesses

details: This powerful nosode introduced by Dr. J.J. Garth Wilkinson, covers symptoms which suggest integral parts of consumption, cancer, syphilis, etc., and promises useful service in the treatment of ozaena, scrofulous swellings. Pyaemia, erysipelas. Chronic rhinitis; sanious secretion.
